page.title: 15Housing development
page.content: Hassocks is surrounded by farmland with some ribbon development along { {Ockley Lane}and some 1930's built housing along{Ockley Way, Manor {Avenue, Mackie Avenue}and some down{ {Grand Avenue.} The general style is of low, squat bungalows with some terraced bungalows and a few normal, two storey houses. While appearing small from the outside some of these bungalows are very roomy internally. They are quite pleasant to look at and most have large back and front gardens. { Ockley Manor}was obviously built at the centre of a thriving farming community but its lands have been slowly nibbled away at the southern end by new housing developments. Now it is only 100 metres away from the northern end of{Mackie Avenue.}
